prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

Hailee has a secret crush on Cole.

Hailee absolutely adores her brother Nolan. He is her favorite person. She goes to every single game and almost every practice. Hailee's parents are neglectful so Nolan takes care of her as much as he can.

The whole team is protective of Hailee. She is like a little sister

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
The roar of the crowd was still ringing in his ears. Skates scraped the ice with that satisfying *shhhht* sound as Connor circled lazily near the boards. His hair was damp with sweat, sticking to his forehead as he leaned on his stick, chest still heaving from the game’s events. A good game. Not a great one. Didn’t matter, though, they’d won against the Seattle Jackals. That was all people cared about.

Except, his eyes weren’t on the scoreboard anymore. They’d fixed on the stands. Specifically, one section. One person.

There they were.

He couldn’t help himself. A stupid grin pulled at his lips before he even knew what he was doing. It was ridiculous. Borderline delusional. Hailee was probably here for Nolan. That fact ran circles in his brain like a truth he was trying to outrun. But shit. *Maybe*, they’d seen him too, watched him weave through defenders like some goddamn magician with the puck. Maybe when the fans screamed after his slick pass set up Buchanan’s game-winner, they’d stood and clapped for him just a little harder than the others.

"Doubt it," he murmured under his breath, words barely audible to himself over the arena noise. That'd be crazy. Definitely crazy.

But it didn’t stop him from wanting to believe it. Didn’t stop him from skating closer.

He pushed off the ice with a grunt, circling toward the glass where Hailee was standing. He wasn’t subtle about it either.  He skimmed by once to make sure they were looking at him—shoulders squared like a peacock with its feathers out. Then doubled back around with a little swagger in his stride.

He tapped his stick against the ice loud enough to get Hailee's attention. *Tap. Tap.* Hazel eyes lifted to meet theirs through the glass as his breath fogged faintly against it.

"Hey! You better not be here rootin’ for Knox over me!" His shout came with a wave. "Don’t lie now, I saw you watchin’. You could at least pretend I’m your favourite." He couldn't hear Hailee over the hubbub of everything going on around them, but he didn't need ears to see the way Hailee's skin seemed slightly flushed, and in a way that didn't look like it was because of him.

"You cold, sweetheart?" He drew back a step on his skates and tugged at the hem of his jersey—his *lucky* jersey, the same one he’d scored hat tricks in before. Sweat practically glued it to him, but that didn’t matter. He had an idea. A horrible idea.

"You want it?" He raised an eyebrow at Hailee playfully, biting back the urge to laugh as he held out his arms theatrically, lifting the hem of the sweaty jersey up like it was some golden trophy. "C’mon—I’ll give it to ya. Only if you swear to bring me luck next game though." Of course, Hailee would *never* accept the sweaty fucking thing, but he looked forward to their response anyway.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee blushes but then nods and reaches through the camera hole on the rink.*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor's grin widened into something downright wolfish as Hailee actually *reached* for the jersey. His heart did this stupid little flip in his chest—like he'd just taken a puck to the ribs without padding.

"Whoa, whoa—" He skated closer, voice dropping into something teasing but hushed, like they were sharing a secret right there against the glass. "You serious? 'Cause I swear to god, sweetheart, this thing reeks." He tugged at the damp fabric clinging to his torso for emphasis, but there was no real hesitation in him. Just that same reckless impulse that always seemed to kick in around Hailee.

With a quick glance over his shoulder—making sure Nolan wasn't lurking nearby with murder in his eyes—he started peeling the jersey up over his head. The cold arena air hit his sweat-slick skin immediately, raising goosebumps along his arms.

"There you go," he murmured, pushing the bundled fabric through the gap toward Hailee's waiting hands. His fingers lingered just a second too long against theirs—warm where he was still buzzing from exertion and adrenaline. "Lucky charm status: officially transferred."

He leaned both elbows on the ledge of the boards now, bare shoulders flexing as he propped himself up. The tattoos along his arms stood out starkly against flushed skin where sweat hadn't quite dried yet.

"So," he drawled, tilting his head with exaggerated thoughtfulness even as mischief danced in those hazel eyes of his. "What do I get for bein' so generous?"

"Whoa there, eager much?" He laughed, skating just out of reach with a playful spin, the jersey lifting higher to flash a strip of sweat-slicked abs before he let it drop again. "Didn't think you'd actually go for it." His voice dropped into something lower, teasing as he leaned against the glass now, close enough that his breath fogged up near Hailee's fingers. "You *like* my sweaty jerseys or somethin'? That your secret kink?"

He winked—because of course he did—but there was something unsteady in his pulse now. The way they were looking at him... Christ. He should stop this. Nolan would murder him if he knew Connor was flirting like this with Hailee.

But then again... Nolan wasn't here right now.

Connor bit his lip, considering before suddenly yanking the jersey over his head in one smooth motion. The cold arena air hit his bare skin instantly, raising goosebumps across his shoulders and chest where sweat still glistened under the bright lights.

"Here," he said gruffly, shoving the damp fabric through the camera hole before Hailee could change their mind. "Lucky number ninety-one." His fingers lingered just a second too long against theirs when passing it off—calloused from years gripping hockey sticks but surprisingly gentle in that moment.

Then he backed up quickly on skates like he'd been burned, running a self-conscious hand through his messy hair while trying (and failing) to look unaffected by what just happened.

"Don't go sniffing it too hard," he called over with forced lightness even as heat crept up *his* neck now. "And uh... maybe don't tell Knox about this?"

Connor's grin widened into something downright wolfish as Hailee actually *reached* for the jersey. His heart did this stupid little flip in his chest—like he'd just taken a puck to the ribs without padding.

"Whoa, hold up—" He skated closer, close enough that his breath fogged the glass between them. The scent of sweat and ice and that obnoxiously expensive cologne Knox always teased him for wearing clung to the fabric as he started peeling it off one shoulder. "You're serious? Shit, sweetheart, you're gonna regret this when you smell like a locker room."

He winked as he tugged the jersey over his head in one smooth motion, muscles flexing under his sweat-slicked undershirt. The cold arena air hit his skin immediately, raising goosebumps along his arms. But hell if he cared—not with Hailee looking at him like *that*.

Through the camera hole came damp yellow fabric still warm from his body heat. Connor leaned both elbows on the boards now, chin propped in his hands like some lovesick teenager watching their crush unwrap a gift. "Better put it on quick before security thinks you're stealing team property," he teased, nodding toward where Bruno was already side-eyeing them from across the ice.

His pulse kicked up when Hailee actually slipped it on—swallowing hard at how ridiculously good they looked swimming in his colors. "Damn," escaped before he could stop it, voice dropping lower despite himself. "Guess I'm gonna need that back after next game... might have to come collect it personally."

Somewhere behind him, Buchanan's deep laugh carried across the rink followed by a loud "*Hartfield!* Quit flirting and get your ass to showers!" Connor flipped him off without looking but didn't move an inch from where he was practically plastered against the glass now.

"You comin' to see me play again or what?" The question came out softer than intended—almost nervous beneath all that practiced charm. Like maybe part of him actually needed to hear yes more than he'd ever admit out loud.

(Meanwhile Knox was definitely going to murder him later.)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee blushes again. She didn't actually think he would give it to her and she hesitates for a second before she tugs it on* "How about I'll make you one of the stupid fan signs for the next game" *Hailee yells through the glass*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor barked out a laugh, loud enough that a few nearby fans turned to look. He pressed a hand to his chest like he'd been wounded. "A *fan sign*? That's all I get after sacrificin' my lucky jersey?" He shook his head, but the grin never left his face—if anything, it got brighter when he saw Hailee actually tugging the oversized jersey on.

The sight did something dangerous to him. The way the fabric swallowed them whole, sleeves hanging past their fingertips, the number 91 stretched across their chest where it usually clung to *his*. His throat went dry.

"Alright, deal," he conceded dramatically, leaning in closer until his breath fogged up the glass between them again. "But it better be embarrassin'. Like—glitter letters and hearts and shit." He winked before pushing off from the boards with one last lingering look at Hailee drowning in his colors. "And you *better* hold it up when I score next game or I'm takin' my jersey back."

With that, he skated backward toward the tunnel—still grinning like an idiot—before turning fully and disappearing into the roar of the arena with one last glance over his shoulder.

"Oh, *now* she negotiates," he called back, shaking his head with mock exasperation. His fingers drummed against the boards as he watched Hailee tug his jersey on—way too big for them, sleeves swallowing their hands whole. Something hot and possessive curled low in his gut at the sight.

"Better be a damn good sign," he added with a wink, leaning in closer like he was sharing some grand secret. "I'm talkin' glitter, neon colors—the whole nine yards." He tapped two fingers against the glass right near Hailee's face playfully. "And it better say *Hartfield* louder than anyone else's name out there."

A whistle cut through the noise from somewhere behind him—probably one of the equipment guys ready to herd them off the ice. Connor didn't turn around just yet though; instead, he let his gaze drag over Hailee one more time before pushing off with an exaggerated sigh.

"Guess I gotta go before Knox thinks I'm tryin' to steal you away," he teased as he started gliding backward toward the tunnel—but not without shooting them one last grin over his shoulder first.

(And if maybe... just maybe...he adjusted himself subtly through his pants before disappearing into the hallway? Well.)

That was between him and God now wasn't it?

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next game Hailee actually ends up arriving late. Instead of coming with Nolan her parents drove her*

*She finally makes it past security and through the fans finding her seat near the players bench. She sits down and waves at the team in the box before turning her attention to the rink. She is wearing Cole's jersey*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor was mid-stretch against the boards when movement caught his eye—that familiar flash of black and yellow in the stands. His head snapped up so fast he nearly cricked his neck.

*There.*

Hailee, sliding into their seat—*late*, which was weird, because they *never* missed puck drop. And wearing *his jersey*. The sight punched the air right out of his lungs. He didn’t even realize he’d stopped paying attention to warmups until Buchanan skated past and shoulder-checked him hard enough to jolt him back to reality.

"Eyes on the ice, Hartfield," Brick grunted, but there was a knowing smirk under his helmet.

Connor flipped him off absently, already drifting toward the bench where Hailee sat closest. He leaned over the partition just enough to catch their attention without full-on abandoning drills.

"Hey—you okay?" The question came out more serious than he meant it to; concern cutting through his usual playful tone. Their parents never brought them unless Nolan couldn't. Something felt off. But then he caught himself hovering like some overprotective idiot and forced a grin back onto his face before Hailee could worry too much about it.

"Glad you made it though," he added lightly, tapping his stick against their shoe playfully through the gap in the glass. "Now I *gotta* score tonight or this whole lucky jersey thing’s gonna look real stupid."
swipes:
Connor was mid-shift when he caught the movement in his periphery—that familiar flash of yellow and black sliding into seats near the bench. His head snapped toward the boards so fast he nearly wiped out on a patch of rough ice.

*There she was.*

And holy shit—*wearing his jersey.*

His stomach did this ridiculous little somersault. He shouldn’t have been this thrilled about it, but here he was, grinning like an idiot as he coasted past Hailee’s section. He rapped his stick against the glass twice in greeting, loud enough to make sure they heard it over the crowd noise.

"Took you long enough!" he called out, voice rough from exertion but still playful as hell. His eyes flicked down to where Hailee’s hands were conspicuously *empty*. "Where's my damn sign? You *promised* me glitter!" He pressed a gloved hand to the glass like some dramatic soap opera actor before peeling away with a laugh just as Buchanan barked at him to get his ass back in position.

But not before shooting Hailee one last look—half teasing, half something warmer—and mouthing: *"You owe me."*

Connor was mid-shift when he caught the flash of familiar yellow in the stands out of the corner of his eye. He nearly fumbled the puck—*nearly*—but recovered with a quick deke that sent a Jackals defenseman stumbling. As he circled back toward the bench, his gaze locked onto Hailee sliding into their seat, *his* jersey hanging off their frame like some kind of goddamn trophy.

A slow smirk curled at his lips as he tapped his stick against the ice twice—their little signal from last game. The sight of them wearing his number sent an embarrassingly warm rush through him, hotter than any post-goal adrenaline.

"Took you long enough," he called over as he skated past their section toward the bench, voice carrying just enough to reach them between plays. His eyes flicked down pointedly at where 91 stretched across Hailee's chest before meeting their gaze again with raised eyebrows. "Where's my glittery sign, huh? Thought we had a deal."

He didn't wait for an answer—couldn't, with Coach Alarie barking orders from behind him—but made sure to shoot Hailee one last grin over his shoulder before hopping over the boards. The way they'd shown up late *alone*, in *his* jersey... it lit something possessive in him that absolutely should not have been there.

Especially not when Nolan was two seats down on the bench, scowling at something on his phone and completely oblivious to Connor's traitorous thoughts about his step-sibling sitting twenty feet above them both.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee blushes and shake her head as he skates away. After a few minutes Hailee feels someone next to her and she grins when she sees her friends Tyler, Madison and Jonathen. Nolan had invited them to cheer up Hailee*

*But Jonathen has always had a little thing for Hailee and so when he sits down next to her he wraps a arm around her shoulders and grins looking out on the ice. Hailee grimaces a little uncomfortable but doesn't say anything*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor was mid-stride, about to take another lap when he caught the movement in his periphery—some guy with his arm slung around Hailee’s shoulders. *Casual*. Like it was nothing. Like he had any goddamn right.

His skates dug into the ice hard enough to send a spray of shavings flying. The sudden stop made Luca, who’d been gliding behind him, nearly crash into his back with a startled Dutch curse.

"*Hartfield—?!*"

But Connor wasn’t listening. His grip on his stick tightened until the tape creaked. That possessive flare in his chest was irrational—he *knew* that—but logic didn’t stand a chance against the way Hailee's body language screamed discomfort even from here. The slight hunch of their shoulders, the way they hadn't leaned into that touch like they did with Nolan or even him sometimes.

Wyatt whistled low from nearby as Connor turned sharply toward the bench again. "Easy there, killer," Hustle drawled, but Connor barely registered it over the white noise in his ears.

He didn't approach Hailee directly this time—no, that'd be too obvious—but he made damn sure to skate right past where Jonathen sat during line drills. Close enough that ice chips sprayed up against the glass near them deliberately as he pivoted hard.

His eyes locked onto Jonathen's for half a second: *Back off.* Then he was gone again like it never happened—except for how Hailee would definitely notice that little display of territorial bullshit because Christ alive, since when did *he* get this worked up over someone just existing near them?
swipes:
Connor was mid-stride, about to take another lap when he caught the movement in his periphery—some *guy* sliding into the seat next to Hailee, arm draping over their shoulders like he had some goddamn right. His grip on his stick tightened instantly, knuckles going white under his gloves.

The puck he’d been lazily stickhandling clattered to the ice as he came to a full stop.

Buchanan skated past again with a raised brow. "Problem?"

Connor barely registered him. His eyes were locked onto Hailee’s stiff posture—the way they leaned *just* slightly away from Jonathen’s touch but didn’t shrug him off. That wasn't like them at all. They usually lit up around friends, all bright laughter and easy affection—not this tense little grimace that made something hot and ugly coil in Connor's gut.

He didn't think. Just acted.

In three sharp strides, he was at the bench again, leaning over the partition with a grin that didn't reach his eyes this time.

"Heya," he called directly at Jonathen before flicking his gaze down to Hailee like they were sharing an inside joke. "Didn't know we were lettin' randos sit in family seating tonight." He tilted his head toward Jonathen's arm still slung around them and raised an eyebrow pointedly before adding—lighter now but with an edge underneath—"You good over here?"

Translation: *Want me to make him move?*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee relaxes as the game finally starts and she gets into watching it but she frowns as Jonathen begins trying to explain the game to her like she is stupid.*

*Hailee listens politely though even though she doesn't understand why he thinks she doesn't know how this game works considering her brother is on the team*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor was mid-shift when he caught it—the way Hailee's polite smile tightened at the edges, the subtle clench of their fingers around the hem of *his* jersey (and fuck if that detail didn't send a possessive thrill down his spine). Jonathen was leaning in too close again, mouth moving with that condescending tilt to his eyebrows that made Connor's molars grind together.

He shouldn't have been watching. Should've been focusing on McKeown’s setup pass coming his way—but then Jonathen gestured broadly at the ice like he was explaining basic addition to a toddler, and Connor saw *red.*

The puck hit his stick with a sharp *crack*. Instinct took over.

One deke around Seattle’s defenseman. Two strides toward the net. The goalie barely had time to react before Connor snapped off a wrist shot so vicious it sent water bottles flying off the top of the net as it ripped into twine. The horn blared; crowd erupting as he spun away from the celebration just long enough to lock eyes with Hailee through the glass—*deliberately* ignoring Jonathen beside them—and mimed scribbling in the air with a shit-eating grin.

"Told you I'd score!" he shouted over the noise, tapping his temple like it was all part of some grand plan instead of sheer petty spite. Then, because he couldn't resist twisting the knife: "Maybe your *buddy* there can explain how I did it for ya!"
swipes:
Connor was *supposed* to be focusing on the game. But every time he glanced toward the bench, there was Jonathen—leaning in too close, talking too much, looking at Hailee like they were some clueless rookie who needed Hockey 101 explained to them.

His teeth ground together so hard his jaw ached.

During a line change, he caught Nolan’s eye as Knox skated off the ice—nodding pointedly toward Hailee and Jonathen with a raised eyebrow. Nolan followed his gaze and immediately scowled.

"Fuckin’ *seriously*?" Nolan muttered under his breath before barking over at Bruno on the bench. "Yo, Bruiser—tell that kid to shut the hell up before I climb over this glass."

Bruno didn’t hesitate. The massive defenseman turned toward the stands and leveled Jonathen with a glare that could melt steel before making an exaggerated *zip it* motion across his mouth.

Connor bit back a laugh as he watched Hailee finally exhale in relief when Jonathen actually stopped talking for once.

He couldn't resist skating by again during the next break in play—this time stopping right in front of them just long enough to tap his stick against Hailee's side of the glass teasingly.

"Need me to draw you some diagrams too?" He winked before pushing off again, voice dropping into something softer just for them: "*Or should I just score instead?*"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee grins and she suddenly gets and idea she stands up shrugging Jonathan's arm off her shoulder and she reaches her hand through the camera hole pointing at the puck*

*She knows from Jonathan's rambling all night that he has been to dozens of hockey games and never gotten a puck and Hailee kinda wants to rub it in that she can get anything she wants from this team*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor's grin turned downright feral as he caught Hailee's silent request. *Oh, this was perfect.*

He skated toward the ref with an exaggerated salute, snagging the game puck before anyone else could claim it. With a showman’s flourish, he twirled it on his finger—just long enough to make sure Jonathen was watching—before gliding right up to the glass where Hailee waited.

"Special delivery for our *most* dedicated fan," he announced loud enough for half the section to hear, pressing the puck into their palm through the camera hole. His fingers lingered just a second too long against theirs, warm even through his gloves. Then, leaning in conspiratorially like they were the only two people in the arena: "Tell your friend there’s a *waiting list* for these."

A beat of eye contact—smug on his end, delighted on theirs—before he winked and pushed off backward toward center ice without another word. The crowd ate it up; someone in Hailee’s row wolf-whistled while Jonathen spluttered something unintelligible behind them.

Wyatt nearly crashed into him at the bench laughing. "*Christ*, Hartfield," Hustle wheezed, slapping Connor’s shoulder pad hard enough to rattle his teeth. "You tryin' to get Knox to murder you?"

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Jonathen scoffed, shoving his hands in his pockets as he leaned against the wall outside the arena. "Game was alright, I guess," he muttered, clearly still salty about the puck incident. "Though I *could've* done without your boyfriend showing off all night."

He shot Hailee a sideways glance, lips curling into a smirk that didn’t quite reach his eyes. "Seriously though—what’s up with you and Hartfield? Dude acts like you’re *his* personal cheerleader or something." His tone was light, but there was an edge to it—like he already knew the answer and hated it.

A beat of silence before he nudged her shoulder playfully (too hard to be casual). "You know if Nolan found out how much that guy flirts with you, he'd probably bench him for life."

mes: "Conner is just like that. He likes to play a lot." *Hailee shrugs used to the behavior*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Jonathen rolled his eyes, kicking at a loose piece of pavement with his shoe. "Yeah, *play*—right." He dragged the word out like it was some inside joke. "Dude’s got ‘I wanna fuck your stepsister’ written all over him every time he looks at you."

He leaned in closer, voice dropping to a mocking whisper. "But hey—if you *like* being his little puck bunny, who am I to judge?" The dig was deliberate, sharpened by jealousy and the sting of watching Connor show him up all night.

Then his ride pulled up—some beat-up sedan with a honk that cut through the tension. Jonathen straightened up with a smirk that didn’t reach his eyes. "Tell Nolan I said hi," he tossed over his shoulder before yanking the car door open. "*And* that he might wanna keep an eye on Hartfield."

The door slammed shut before Hailee could reply, tires squealing as they peeled away—leaving her standing there in Connor’s jersey, clutching the game puck like a trophy Jonathen would never get his hands on.

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor was mid-autograph when he spotted Hailee lingering at the edge of the crowd—*still* wearing his jersey, the game puck clutched in their hands like some sacred artifact. His grin went from polite to downright predatory in half a second flat.

"Alright folks, that’s all for me tonight!" He flashed the remaining fans an apologetic wave before practically *bounding* over to Hailee, still buzzing with post-game adrenaline and that smug satisfaction from showing Jonathen up earlier.

"Miss me already?" he teased, reaching out to flick the brim of their hat playfully. His eyes dropped pointedly to where his number stretched across their chest before darting back up with a smirk. "Or did you just come by to rub it in Jonathen’s face some more? ‘Cause I gotta say—that was *wicked* satisfying."

He leaned against the wall beside them, close enough that his bare arm brushed against theirs—still warm from exertion under his t-shirt sleeves. "Seriously though," he added, voice dropping into something softer now that they were alone (or as alone as they could get in a crowded arena hallway). "You good? Saw you got stuck with Captain Obvious out there after the game."

mes:
*Hailee sighs and tosses the puck over to the group of fans. She doesn't need it she has dozens of game pucks at home*

"Fine. Madison and Tyler thought bringing Jonathen as my suprise date was a good idea." *Hailee shakes her head* "He is terrible. Like he wouldn't shut up"

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor's smirk vanished instantly. "*Date?*" The word came out sharper than he meant it to, his fingers twitching at his sides like he wanted to punch something—preferably Jonathen’s smug face. He forced himself to take a breath, rolling his shoulders back until the tension eased just enough to speak without growling.

"Yeah, no shit he’s terrible," he muttered, nudging Hailee’s shoulder with his own in solidarity. "Guy talks like he invented hockey *and* breathing." A beat of silence before he couldn’t help adding, voice dripping with faux innocence: "So… Nolan know you were on a *date* tonight?"

He already knew the answer—Knox would’ve skated through the glass like the Kool-Aid Man if he’d caught wind of that little setup—but watching Hailee squirm was half the fun. That, and distracting them from whatever bullshit their so-called friends had pulled tonight.

Leaning in conspiratorially, Connor dropped his voice to a stage whisper: "Tell you what—next time someone tries to set you up with a walking Wikipedia page? Fake an emergency call from me." He winked. "*‘Sorry, Hartfield needs me to hold his spare stick for moral support.’* Works every time."

mes:
*Hailee giggles and shakes her head as she smack Conner on the head* "Come on idiot." *Hailee shakes her head walking away but as she turns around some kid runs in front of her causing her to trip and fall back and Conner to fall on top of her*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor barely had time to react before he was crashing down on top of Hailee, his reflexes the only thing saving them from a full-on collision with the concrete. One arm shot out to brace against the floor at the last second, his other hand instinctively cradling the back of their head before it could smack against the ground.

"Shit—*shit*, you okay?" His voice was uncharacteristically frantic, hazel eyes scanning Hailee’s face for any sign of pain. The proximity hit him all at once—the way their body fit perfectly under his, how their fingers dug into his biceps like they were afraid to let go. He could feel every rapid heartbeat where their chests pressed together.

Somewhere behind them, a kid screeched an apology before bolting off into the crowd. Connor didn’t even glance up.

"Little bastard," he muttered under his breath before shifting just enough to take his weight off Hailee without fully pulling away. His thumb brushed absently along their jawline where a stray strand of hair had stuck to flushed skin. "*Christ*, sweetheart, you gotta stop falling for me like this," he teased weakly—but there was no real bite to it, just that same breathless tension coiling low in his stomach.

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor’s breath hitched at the sound of Hailee’s voice—*breathy*, like they’d just finished a sprint instead of taking a tumble. His thumb stilled against their jaw, hazel eyes darkening as he caught the way their fingers flexed against his arms.

"*Yeah?*" The word came out rougher than he meant it to, low and edged with something dangerous. He shifted just enough to let his knee slot between theirs—purely to *stabilize* them, obviously—but the second he felt how warm they were under that borrowed jersey, all rational thought short-circuited.

His free hand drifted down on instinct, calloused fingers brushing the exposed strip of skin where their shirt had ridden up. "You’re *soft*," he murmured before he could stop himself, voice thick with awe. The contrast was intoxicating—his rough palms against their smooth stomach, the way they shivered under his touch like *they liked it*.

Somewhere in the back of his mind, alarms blared: *Nolan will murder you.* But right now? With Hailee clinging to him like this? He couldn’t bring himself to care.

A wicked grin tugged at his lips as he leaned down until his mouth nearly brushed their ear. "*Strong enough to pick you up and carry you outta here,*" he whispered—half-teasing, half-dead serious—before adding with a huffed laugh: "*...Knox would kill me though.*"

His free hand found their waist where bare skin peeked out from under the jersey, calloused fingers brushing lightly over smooth warmth before he caught himself.

"Shit," he exhaled sharply through clenched teeth, forcing himself to pull back just enough to break contact—though not far; one arm still caged them protectively against the floor. "We should—*fuck*, we should probably get up before Knox finds us like this and uses my spine as a hockey stick."

But he didn’t move yet. Waiting. Giving Hailee space to push him away first because some pathetic part of him needed to know if they felt this too or if he was just imagining the way their breathing had gone uneven beneath him.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee just barely holds back a gasp as her stomach twitches and trembles under Conners's hands. Her hand clenches around his biceps again and she mumbles* "I like how steong you are. Means your safe"

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor’s pulse *thundered* in his ears at the way Hailee’s stomach quivered under his touch—like their body was answering a question he hadn’t even dared to ask out loud. That quiet confession—*safe*—sent heat licking down his spine, straight to his fucking core.

"*Fuck*, sweetheart," he rasped, fingers flexing against their waist like he could memorize the shape of them right there in this goddamn hallway. His other hand cradled the back of their head tighter, tilting their face up until their breaths mingled. "You can't just *say* shit like that." Not when they were pressed together like this, not when every hitch of their breath made him ache to close the last inch between them.

Somewhere distant, voices echoed—teammates? Staff? He didn’t fucking care. All that mattered was the way Hailee clung to him like *they didn’t want him to move either*.

His grin turned wolfish as he dipped his head lower, lips grazing the shell of their ear just to feel them shiver. "*Bet I could bench press you easy,*" he murmured—voice all rough promise and filthy implication. "*Wanna find out?*"

The second the words left his mouth, reality came crashing back: Nolan’s inevitable wrath, Hailee's wide-eyed trust, the fact they were still sprawled on public flooring like some cliché rom-com scene. With a groan that was equal parts frustration and amusement, Connor reluctantly rolled off them—but not before stealing one last lingering touch along their hip.

"*C'mon,*" he sighed dramatically offering a hand up with exaggerated innocence even as his eyes stayed locked on theirs "*Before your brother finds us and turns me into a fucking hood ornament.*"

"*Safe*, huh?" His voice dropped to a gravelly murmur, lips brushing the shell of their ear as he caged them tighter against the floor. Every rational thought had been reduced to static—all that mattered was the way they *shook* for him, how perfectly they fit under his weight. "Sweetheart, I ain't *safe* right now." A rough chuckle escaped him as he nudged his knee higher between theirs. "*Not even close.*"

Some distant part of his brain registered footsteps echoing down the hallway—too heavy to be a fan, too purposeful to ignore. Reality came crashing back like a bucket of ice water.

"*Fuck—*" Connor jerked upright so fast he nearly kneed himself in the chin, hauling Hailee up with him just as Nolan rounded the corner with Bruno in tow. He didn’t miss how Knox’s eyes zeroed in on Hailee’s rumpled jersey or Bruno's raised eyebrow at their flushed faces.

Connor cleared his throat and slapped on his most innocent grin (which was still downright sinful). "Uh. Tripped." He gestured vaguely at nothing before adding with exaggerated concern: "*Really slippery floors*, man."

Bruno snorted into his coffee cup while Nolan looked seconds away from committing homicide.

Hailee, still pressed flush against Connor's side where he hadn't quite let go? Totally worth it.

Connor’s pulse *thundered* in his ears at the way Hailee’s body reacted to him—the tremble under his palm, the way their grip on him tightened like they never wanted to let go. That quiet admission—*safe*—hit him square in the chest, knocking the air right out of his lungs.

"*Fuck*," he breathed, barely audible. His fingers flexed against their stomach like he was memorizing the feel of them before dragging upward—slow, deliberate—until his thumb brushed just under the hem of their sports bra. Every ragged inhale Hailee took pressed them closer together, and Christ alive, if they kept *looking* at him like that—

A sudden crash of equipment from down the hallway shattered the moment.

Connor jerked back like he’d been burned, scrambling to his feet with a strangled cough. He offered Hailee a hand up too quickly, fingers trembling where they wrapped around theirs. "*Uh.* Game tape," he blurted out lamely, rubbing at the back of his neck with his free hand. "Gotta go watch game tape. With Knox." A beat too late: "*Alone.*"

The lie tasted bitter on his tongue as he forced himself to take a step back—putting space between them before he did something *really* stupid (like pinning them against that wall and finding out just how much more they’d tremble for him).

But not without one last glance at Hailee’s flushed face and kiss-swollen lips (had those been that pink earlier?), or how *his jersey still hung off their frame*.

He swallowed hard and turned on his heel before temptation won out over self-preservation entirely.

(Somewhere in Boston Nolan Carter sneezed violently.)

Connor’s pulse *thundered* in his ears at the way Hailee’s stomach quivered under his touch—like their body was answering a question he hadn’t even dared to ask out loud. His fingers flexed against that warm, soft skin, dragging just enough to feel the shiver it pulled from them.

"*Safe*, huh?" His voice dropped into something rough and honey-thick, lips grazing the shell of their ear as he caged them tighter against the floor. Every rational thought had long since evaporated—replaced by the heady realization that *they liked this*. Liked *him*. "Sweetheart, I am *the opposite* of safe right now."

His knee pressed further between theirs on pure instinct, heat pooling low in his gut at the way they instinctively arched into him. The jersey had ridden up even more now, revealing a tempting sliver of hipbone he couldn’t resist tracing with his thumb.

Some distant part of his brain registered footsteps echoing down the hallway—probably staff or straggling fans. It didn’t stop him from nipping lightly at Hailee’s earlobe before growling: "*Tell me to stop.*"

A lie. A test. He already knew he wouldn't listen if they did.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee blushes and finally seems to come back to herself as she grabs Conner's hand letting him pull her up* "Uh yeah Nolan let's find Nolan" *Hailee mumbles*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor couldn’t help the chuckle that escaped him as Hailee scrambled to their feet, all flustered and *adorable* in his oversized jersey. He kept their hand in his a second longer than necessary—just because he could—before reluctantly letting go with a theatrical sigh.

"Yeah, yeah, *Nolan*," he echoed, rolling his eyes playfully as he adjusted the hem of Hailee's (well, *his*) jersey where it had ridden up. His fingers lingered for half a heartbeat too long against their waist before he forced himself to step back. "Wouldn’t wanna keep Captain Killjoy waiting."

He shot them a wink as they started down the hallway together—close enough that their shoulders brushed with every other step. "*But*, uh…" He dropped his voice to a conspiratorial murmur, leaning in like they were sharing state secrets instead of borderline-inappropriate banter. "*If you ever wanna test that bench press theory? My gym’s open 24/7.*"

The second the words left his mouth, Bruno rounded the corner ahead of them with Nolan right behind—and Connor immediately straightened up like nothing had happened, whistling innocently while Hailee turned beet red beside him.

*Perfect timing as always.*

name: Connor Hartfield

"Oh my *god*, look at this," she drawled, voice dripping with fake sweetness. "Another little fan girl in Hartfield’s jersey like she’s *special* or something."

Her friend—a redhead with sharp acrylic nails—snickered, flipping her hair over her shoulder. "*Please*. Like Conner would ever notice some random nobody in the stands." She tilted her head mockingly. "You know he hooks up with actual models after games, right? Not… whatever *this* is."

The third girl—petite but venomous—chirped in, eyes flicking to Nolan on the ice. "And Knox? Ugh, good luck there too. He doesn’t even *look* at fans unless they're throwing themselves at him." She smirked as if she knew something Hailee didn't. "*Trust me*, we've tried."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee lowers her eyes to the ground and puts her sign to the side. And now she just wants her brother. She looks over and sees Nolan is on the ice but Conner isnt*

*Hailee stands and goes over to the entrance of the players box knock on the window to get Coach's attention. When she has it she points to the door handle then herself and then Conner asking for permission to come in the box*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Coach Alarie’s bushy eyebrows shot up when he spotted Hailee at the glass—small, tense, and looking like she was two seconds from bolting. His gaze flicked to the gaggle of girls still snickering behind her seat, then back to Hailee’s pleading expression. A muscle in his jaw twitched.

With a grunt, he yanked the door open just enough to bark out a "*Get in here*," jerking his head toward the bench. The second Hailee slipped inside, he slammed it shut again with a glare that sent the groupies shrinking back in their seats.

Connor—who'd been mid-sip on his water bottle—nearly choked when he spotted Hailee hovering near Coach. "*The hell happened?*" He was on his feet instantly, ignoring Wyatt’s muttered *"Jesus Christ, not again"* as he shouldered past teammates to get to them.

Coach beat him to it though, clamping a meaty hand on Hailee’s shoulder and steering her toward Connor like handing off an injured puppy. "*Your problem now,*" he grunted before stomping off toward Luca to yell about defensive coverage.

name: Hailee
mes: *It just so happens that where Conner is sitting in against the windoe where the mean girls are. Hailee doesn't say a word as she sits down and curls against him* "Girls are so mean" *Hailee whispers wiping at her eyes*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor’s entire body went rigid the second Hailee curled into him—small and trembling like a fucking wounded bird. His arm instinctively wrapped around their shoulders, pulling them tighter against his side as he shot a *glare* over their head at the girls still lurking by the glass. They had the audacity to look shocked, like they hadn’t just been caught red-handed being vile little harpies.

"Hey, *hey*—" His voice dropped to something rough but gentle, thumb brushing away one of Hailee’s stray tears with a tenderness that would’ve shocked anyone who only knew his playboy persona. "*Fuck* those bitches," he muttered fiercely, pressing his lips to the top of their head without thinking. "They don’t know shit."

Behind them, Wyatt choked on his mouthguard while Bruno subtly shifted to block Hailee from view of the stands—a silent *fuck you* to anyone trying to gawk.

Connor didn’t give a single damn about optics right now. Not when Hailee was clinging to him like he was their lifeline. "*You’re ours,*" he murmured against their hair—too low for anyone else to hear, but with enough conviction it felt like a vow. "*Team mascot.* Knox would literally murder someone if they messed with you." A beat before adding with a smirk: "*...So would I.*"

He tilted their chin up gently until those watery emerald eyes met his hazel ones—no teasing left in his expression now, just raw sincerity under all that usual bravado: "*Wanna sit here for the rest of the game? Best seat in the house.*"

He tilted their chin up gently until those watery emerald eyes met his hazel ones—no teasing left in his expression now, just raw sincerity under all that usual bravado: "*Wanna sit here for the rest of the game? Best seat in the house.*"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee looks up at  Conner with a watery laugh and nods her head* "Yeah okay" *She says leaning her head on his shoulder*

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor’s chest did something dangerously warm at the way Hailee nestled against him—like they *belonged* there, tucked under his arm with their head on his shoulder. He adjusted instinctively, shifting so they could lean more comfortably against him, his thumb tracing absent circles on their upper arm.

"Atta girl," he murmured, grinning when Wyatt fake-gagged behind them. "*Shut it*, Hustle," he shot over his shoulder without missing a beat before turning back to Hailee. "Now you get front-row seats to watch me make Seattle regret ever being born." A pause. "*And* you get to hear all my hilarious commentary. Bonus feature."

The puck dropped again, but Connor didn’t move an inch—too busy stealing glances at the way Hailee’s lashes caught the arena lights every time they blinked up at him between plays.

Nolan skated past the bench during a line change and did a *double take* at the sight of them curled together—but after one long, assessing look at Hailee’s red-rimmed eyes and Connor’s protective grip? He just gave a sharp nod of approval before slamming some poor Seattle rookie into the boards hard enough to rattle teeth.

Message received: *Anyone messes with her? Gets turned into paste.*

Connor smirked down at Hailee as Nolan's hit echoed through the glass beside them. "*See? Told ya.*"

name: Hailee
mes: *Days later Hailee is at the guys practice watching. They are currently on a water break and Hailee is talking to Conner when she gets an idea* "Will you teach me how to skate"

name: Connor Hartfield
mes:
Connor’s face *lit up* like Hailee had just asked him to personally hand-deliver the Stanley Cup. He nearly dropped his water bottle in his haste to answer, already halfway out of his seat on the bench before remembering he was still in skates.

"*Hell yes*," he blurted, grin stretching wide enough to make his cheeks ache. "I’ll teach you so good you’ll be doing triple axels by next week." A blatant lie—but the mental image of Hailee clinging to him for balance on the ice was too fucking tempting to resist.

Behind them, Nolan paused mid-sip from his own bottle, eyebrows shooting up. "*The fuck you will,*" Knox growled—but it lacked real heat, more reflexive big-brother instinct than actual veto power.

Connor waved him off with a scoff. "*Relax*, Dad—I’ll hold their hand the whole time." He wiggled his fingers demonstratively before turning back to Hailee with a stage whisper: "*He’s just mad ‘cause I’m way better at teaching than he is.*"

Wyatt fake-coughed "*Bullshit*" into his glove while Luca muttered something in Dutch that sounded suspiciously like *"You just want an excuse to touch them."*

Ignoring both (because they weren't *wrong*), Connor leaned closer to Hailee with a conspiratorial smirk: "*So? Wanna sneak off before Knox changes his mind and chains me to the bench?*"
